thread.title: New Orleans Saints injuries: Marques Colston, Damian Swann, Tim Lelito leave game
thread.title_full: New Orleans Saints injuries: Marques Colston, Damian Swann, Tim Lelito leave game | NOLA.com

author: Evan Woodbery, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: New Orleans Saints injuries: Marques Colston, Damian Swann, Tim Lelito leave game
text:
PHILADELPHIA -- New Orleans Saints receiver Marques Colston left Sunday's game after suffering an injury in the second half and later was seen wearing a sling on his right arm.
Colston was one of at least four players forced to leave the game due to injury.
Cornerback Damian Swann suffered what the team said was a head injury in the first half. He didn't return.
Swann's replacement at nickel back, Kyle Wilson, was shaken up twice due to injury. The second time, he left directly for the locker room. No in-game announcement was made about the injury. Reserve Brian Dixon played in his place.
Guard Tim Lelito also left the game and went to the locker room late in the game. No in-game announcement was made about an injury. Reserve Mike McGlynn played the rest of the game in Lelito's place.
Punter Thomas Morstead (quadriceps), defensive lineman Bobby Richardson (hip) and offensive tackle Terron Armstead (knee) were all inactive on Sunday due to injury.
